level.heading: Stay of proceedings pending appeal of foreign-country judgment.
level.text: If a party establishes that an appeal from a foreign-country judgment is pending or will be taken, the court may stay any proceedings with regard to the foreign-country judgment until the:
Appellant has had sufficient time to prosecute the appeal and has failed to do so.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-86
level.text: For history of Law 19-86, see notes under § 15-361.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 8 of the Uniform Foreign-Country Money Judgments Recognition Act.
